It was the third day of the retreat.
He showed that he was slightly ill.
He then stopped eating.
His instructions were more earnest than usual.
The crowd of attendants didn't get fond of him.
The teacher instructed them with a verse, saying.
"In life, there are sensations that must be repaid.
Don't be anxious about old age, illness, and death.
Take away the patient acceptance of the nonarising of things.
Naturally, karmic consciousness disappears.
One moment, clouds of purity and constant radiance arise.
The Buddhas and patriarchs all rest at this site of enlightenment.
On the 14th, he wrote a resignation to the laity.
On the sixteenth, he wrote a verse about raising the fire.
The next morning, after he had washed and wiped himself, he wrote in large letters.
He asked for a writing brush and wrote in large letters.
'Today, I'll clearly show you.'
He threw down his brush, sat down cross-legged, and passed away.
Seven people lost their support.
Jāmbī's bones and teeth remained intact.
He stood behind the tower's abbot.
His life expectancy was 71 years.
He had a life of forty-four years as a monk.
Hanshan Qingyun.

source_sentence: 師不唯法眼圓明一振頺綱。
translation: "Not only did he have a perfectly clear eye for the Dharma and an unified chain of command, but he was also steadfast and solitary.
Rather, his steadfast discipline and solitary style were truly sufficient to raise the ranks of the hermits.
He was truly sufficient to uplift the mundane world.
This is a true record.
